briefdescription.para: Return the length of a string.

simplesect.para: unsigned int Length of string

briefdescription.para: Compare two strings (case-sensitive).

simplesect.para: int 0 if equal, <0 if s1 < s2, >0 if s1 > s2

briefdescription.para: Compare two strings (case-insensitive).

simplesect.para: int 0 if equal, <0 if s1 < s2, >0 if s1 > s2

briefdescription.para: Compare first n characters of two strings (case-sensitive).

simplesect.para: int Comparison result as with strcmp()

briefdescription.para: Compare first n characters of two strings (case-insensitive).

simplesect.para: int Comparison result as with strcmp()

briefdescription.para: Convert a character to uppercase.

simplesect.para: char Uppercase equivalent if alphabetic, otherwise unchanged

briefdescription.para: Check if a character is uppercase.

simplesect.para: int Non-zero if uppercase, 0 otherwise

briefdescription.para: Convert a character to lowercase.

simplesect.para: char Lowercase equivalent if alphabetic, otherwise unchanged

briefdescription.para: Check if a character is alphanumeric.

simplesect.para: int Non-zero if alphanumeric, 0 otherwise

briefdescription.para: Check if a character is whitespace.

simplesect.para: bool true if whitespace, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Check if a character is alphabetic.

simplesect.para: bool true if alphabetic, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Locate first occurrence of a character in a string.

simplesect.para: char* Pointer to first occurrence or NULL if not found

briefdescription.para: Append string with length check.

simplesect.para: uint32_t Length of string attempted to create (may exceed siz)

briefdescription.para: Copy string with length check.

simplesect.para: uint32_t Length of source string

briefdescription.para: Duplicate a string.

simplesect.para: char* Newly allocated copy of string

briefdescription.para: Duplicate a string into the BASIC temporary string arena.

detaileddescription.para: Allocates storage for the given string inside the BASIC interpreter's fixed-size string arena. The returned pointer remains valid until the next call to gc(), which resets the arena.
Unlike kmalloc(), this allocator never frees individual strings; all strings are discarded together when gc() is invoked.

listitem.para: The returned string is immutable. Modifying it (e.g. appending with strlcat or writing past the terminator) will corrupt the string arena and cause undefined behaviour.
Empty strings are interned: all calls with "" return the same canonical pointer.

parameterdescription.para: BASIC interpreter context containing arena state.

simplesect.para: const char* Pointer to the arena-allocated copy, or NULL on error.

briefdescription.para: Reset the BASIC temporary string arena.

detaileddescription.para: Reclaims all strings allocated with gc_strdup() by resetting the arena pointer back to its initial position. This does not free memory back to the system; it simply makes the entire arena available for reuse.
Called automatically at the end of each line execution in the BASIC interpreter.

parameterdescription.para: BASIC interpreter context containing arena state.

simplesect.para: int Always returns 1.

briefdescription.para: Convert a hex string to integer.

simplesect.para: uint64_t Converted value

briefdescription.para: Check if a character is a decimal digit.

simplesect.para: unsigned char Non-zero if digit, 0 otherwise

briefdescription.para: Check if a character is a hexadecimal digit.

simplesect.para: unsigned char Non-zero if hex digit, 0 otherwise

briefdescription.para: Convert string to integer.

simplesect.para: int Converted value

briefdescription.para: Convert string to 64-bit signed integer.

simplesect.para: int64_t Converted value

briefdescription.para: Convert string to 64-bit unsigned integer.

simplesect.para: uint64_t Converted value

briefdescription.para: Convert string to floating point.

simplesect.para: bool true if successful, false if invalid

briefdescription.para: Absolute value of integer.

simplesect.para: int Absolute value

briefdescription.para: Absolute value of 64-bit integer.

simplesect.para: int64_t Absolute value

briefdescription.para: Reverse a string in-place.

simplesect.para: size_t Length of string

briefdescription.para: Core atoi implementation.

simplesect.para: int 0 on success, non-zero on error

briefdescription.para: Convert integer to string.

simplesect.para: int 0 on success, non-zero on error

briefdescription.para: Locate the last occurrence of a character in a string.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the null-terminated string to search.
Character to locate (passed as int, converted to unsigned char).

simplesect.para: Pointer to the last occurrence of c in s, or NULL if not found.

briefdescription.para: Case-insensitive string comparison.

simplesect.para: <0 if s1 < s2, 0 if equal, >0 if s1 > s2 (case-insensitive).

briefdescription.para: Convert a string to lowercase in place.

detaileddescription.para: Iterates over the null-terminated string and replaces any uppercase ASCII letters (A–Z) with their lowercase form.

briefdescription.para: Return visible length of a string ignoring ANSI escapes.

detaileddescription.para: Skips CSI sequences (ESC '[' ... final byte). Only counts characters that would actually be displayed.

simplesect.para: Visible character count.

briefdescription.para: Locate a substring in a string.

detaileddescription.para: Scans the string haystack for the first occurrence of the substring needle. The terminating null character is not compared.
If needle is empty, haystack is returned. If needle does not occur in haystack, NULL is returned.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the beginning of the located substring, or NULL if no match is found.

briefdescription.para: Custom string handling functions with GC support for BASIC runtime.

simplesect.para: Craig Edwards
